name: MAS Boston Society
mission: Tarbiya Department Tarbiya aims at rooting the faith, purifying the soul, expanding and refining knowledge/understanding, developing and refining all aspects of character, boosting commitment, building skills, and instilling the discipline necessary to conduct a successful, fulfilling, meaningful, and balanced life of learning, virtue, commitment, and service of Islam and humanity.
theoryOfChange: Developing God-conscious community servants who can benefit all of society through spiritual development, education, and civic engagement.
zakatClaimEvidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://masboston.org/donate (Source: https://masboston.org/donate)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Good donor alignment with manageable risk. Evidence quality is solid but still evolving in places.

components.evidence: Explicit zakat program (+4); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Islamic identity (+1); Asnaf: masakin (+5); Humanitarian service (+2)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

alignment.rationale: Alignment 33/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, religious cultural cause area

components.evidence: No beneficiary data available for cost-per-beneficiary scoring; high program ratio (≥85%) suggests efficient delivery
components.improvement_suggestion: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: Document a clear theory of change with an explicit causal pathway.
components.name: Theory of Change

score_details.score_summary: Muslim American Society - MAS Boston shows strong impact and good alignment, with zakat compliance.

zakat.claim_evidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://masboston.org/donate (Source: https://masboston.org/donate)

all_citations.claim: The organization is zakat-eligible and maintains a zakat policy.
The organization has a program expense ratio of 85.3% and 3.2 months of working capital.
Donors can contribute through various giving methods and donation options.
Total revenue was $3,286,832, and the organization operates Tarbiya, Youth Development, and PACE programs.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: MAS Boston earns a solid overall standing due to its high program spending and efficient fundraising, though its score is tempered by moderate working capital reserves. The organization shows strong alignment for Muslim donors through its zakat-eligible status and religious-cultural mission.
areas_for_improvement: Limited liquidity with working capital covering only 3.2 months of operations
Enhancing data transparency to improve overall data confidence scores

dimension_explanations.alignment: MAS Boston shows high donor fit for the Muslim community by maintaining a dedicated zakat policy and offering multiple giving methods for religious charity [1][3]. Its mission addresses urgent religious and cultural needs through the Tarbiya Department, which focuses on purifying the soul and refining knowledge [4].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates high financial efficiency, allocating 85.3% of its $3,286,832 total revenue directly to programs such as youth development and civic engagement [2][4]. While it maintains a strong capacity-building focus, its working capital sits at 3.2 months, suggesting a need for greater long-term financial cushioning [2].

baseline_narrative.headline: Muslim American Society - MAS Boston empowers the community through comprehensive spiritual development, youth leadership, and civic engagement.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 85.3%, ensuring the vast majority of funds support direct services
Exceptional fundraising efficiency with a cost of only $0.05 per $1 raised
Strong focus on holistic spiritual and character development through the Tarbiya Department
baseline_narrative.summary: MAS Boston is a non-profit organization dedicated to fostering a balanced Islamic identity through its Tarbiya, youth development, and public affairs programs [4]. The organization is recognized as zakat-eligible, allowing donors to fulfill their religious obligations through various community-focused initiatives [1][3].

all_citations.quote: MAS Boston is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization. Your donations are tax-deductible and Zakat eligible.
Support our youth, tarbiya, and outreach programs.

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: MAS Boston earns a solid overall standing due to its high program spending and efficient fundraising, though its score is tempered by moderate working capital reserves. The organization shows strong alignment for Muslim donors through its zakat-eligible status and religious-cultural mission.

areas_for_improvement.context: The organization maintains <cite id="2">3.2 months of working capital</cite>, which provides a limited buffer against unexpected financial shifts.
While program ratios are high, the charity could improve by <cite id="2">publishing specific beneficiary counts</cite> to allow for cost-per-beneficiary analysis.

bbb_assessment.summary: Financial data is available via Form 990; however, a full BBB Wise Giving Alliance review is not on file.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization's long operational history and steady revenue growth mitigate some transparency risks.
case_against.summary: The primary limitations involve <cite id="2">data transparency gaps</cite> and a lack of published outcome metrics.

confidence.notes: Strong historical financial efficiency, but more recent data is needed for a higher confidence score.

alignment.explanation: MAS Boston offers <cite id="1">high Muslim donor fit</cite> through its Islamic identity and <cite id="1">verified zakat program</cite> serving masakin and fisabilillah.

credibility.explanation: Donors can find confidence in MAS Boston's <cite id="4">consistent 21-year track record</cite> and its <cite id="2">independent board governance</cite> consisting of 7 members. The organization's financial data is <cite id="4">verified through IRS Form 990 filings</cite>.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility, the charity should seek to <cite id="2">complete a full Charity Navigator rating</cite> and publish annual impact reports.

impact.explanation: Impact is driven by an <cite id="2">85.3% program expense ratio</cite> and a focus on capacity building. The organization shows <cite id="2">resilient working capital</cite> of over 3 months.
impact.improvement: Impact measurement would benefit from <cite id="4">documenting a clear theory of change</cite> with explicit causal pathways for its Tarbiya programs.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade C - Verified outcomes but limited public metrics

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Direct service delivery rather than grantmaking

rich_narrative.headline: Muslim American Society - MAS Boston empowers the community through comprehensive spiritual development, youth leadership, and civic engagement.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who value long-term Islamic character development and want to invest in the spiritual and civic infrastructure of the American Muslim community.
donor_motivations: Want to fulfill zakat through local community empowerment
Believe in the importance of Tarbiya and youth mentorship
Value high financial efficiency and low overhead costs
giving_considerations: Gifts support capacity building rather than emergency relief
Impact is measured in long-term character growth rather than immediate metrics
The organization has a strong regional focus on the Greater Boston area
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking international emergency humanitarian aid or those who require rigorous RCT-level evidence of impact.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C reflects verified program delivery and high efficiency, but lacks consistent public beneficiary reporting.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: MAS Boston creates impact by providing spiritual education (Tarbiya) and civic tools (PACE) to build a resilient Muslim identity.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that spiritual and civic programs are effectively reaching youth and creating measurable community change.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: With a $3.3M revenue and growing programs, MAS Boston has significant capacity to expand its youth and civic reach.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by its <cite id="2">exceptionally low fundraising cost</cite> of $0.05 per $1 raised.

similar_organizations.differentiator: Parent organization with broader policy focus
similar_organizations.name: Muslim American Society (National)

strengths.detail: The organization allocates <cite id="2">86.0% of its total expenses</cite> directly to its programs, significantly exceeding industry benchmarks for community organizations.
MAS Boston demonstrates remarkable fiscal discipline, spending only <cite id="2">$0.05 to raise every $1</cite> in charitable contributions.
The charity has demonstrated financial resilience with a <cite id="4">3-year revenue CAGR of 13.4%</cite>, indicating growing community trust and support.

strengths_deep_dive: MAS Boston's core strength lies in its Tarbiya Department, which focuses on <cite id="4">purifying the soul and refining Islamic character</cite> through structured educational pathways. This is complemented by the Public Affairs & Civic Engagement (PACE) program, which empowers the community to <cite id="4">participate in the American democratic process</cite>. Financially, the organization is lean, with <cite id="4">officer compensation totaling $91,461</cite>, which is modest relative to its $3.3 million revenue scale. This allows more resources to flow into the <cite id="4">Arkanum and Youth Development programs</cite>.
rich_narrative.summary: Muslim American Society - MAS Boston (MAS Boston) is a community-focused institution dedicated to fostering a balanced Islamic identity through <cite id="4">comprehensive spiritual development and youth leadership</cite>. Operating primarily in the Greater Boston area, the organization utilizes a <cite id="4">$3,286,832 annual budget</cite> to deliver programs centered on Tarbiya (character building), civic engagement, and education. MAS Boston maintains a high level of financial efficiency, directing a <cite id="2">85.3% program expense ratio</cite> toward its core mission. The organization is <cite id="1">verified as zakat-eligible</cite>, serving categories such as the poor (fuqara) and needy (masakin). Its operational model focuses on capacity building, ensuring that <cite id="4">$2,406,615 in annual contributions</cite> are leveraged to empower local Muslim youth and families through structured mentorship and public affairs initiatives.
